Summary: Project Description
Creator: lilian ikirezi
Description:
Project Description: Blessed Church Website
Project Key: BCW
Project Lead: Melisa Battal
Project Type: Software Development
Project Goal: Build a modern, user-friendly church website with features such as event management, donations, Bible listening, and location information.
Project Overview
The Blessed Church Website is a React-based web application designed to provide a seamless online experience for church members and visitors. The platform will feature an interactive events calendar, an integrated donation system, a Bible listening section, and a contact page with location details. The project aims to enhance community engagement and provide easy access to essential church services online.
Scope & Features
Home Page: A visually appealing homepage with a welcoming message and key highlights.
Navigation Bar: A responsive navbar providing easy access to all sections of the site.
Events Page: A calendar view of upcoming church events with detailed information.
Donations Page: A secure and user-friendly donation platform integrated with a free payment gateway.
Bible Listening Page: An embedded audio player for users to listen to Bible readings.
Location & Contact Page: Displays the church's location (with free parking information) and integrates Google Maps.
Technology Stack
Frontend: React.js, JSX, Bootstrap
Backend: None (Static frontend with third-party integrations)
Database: N/A
Deployment: Vercel / Netlify
Version Control: GitHub
Project Management: Jira
Key Objectives
✅ Enhance user engagement with an intuitive UI/UX
✅ Provide seamless donation processing
✅ Make event information easily accessible
✅ Enable users to listen to Bible readings online
✅ Ensure the site is responsive across devices
Project Timeline & Milestones
Phase	Milestone	Target Completion
Project Setup	Repository setup, environment configuration	Week 1
UI Development	Implement core pages and components	Week 2-3
Feature Development	Implement events, donations, and audio player	Week 4-5
Testing & QA	Ensure bug-free and responsive functionality	Week 6
Deployment	Deploy website to production	Week 7
Stakeholders & Team Members
Product Owner: Melisa Battal
Developers: [List of assigned developers]
QA Tester: [Assign if needed]
Risk & Dependencies
Risk: Potential issues with npm dependencies and payment gateway integration.
Mitigation: Regular updates, dependency management, and contingency plans for payment processing.
Success Criteria
✅ Website loads successfully with no major bugs
✅ All features are functional and accessible
✅ The donation system processes payments without errors
✅ The site is fully responsive across all devices

Summary: npm start fails
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description: {{npm start}} fails to run the React project successfully. The error occurs during the initialization of the development server.

Summary: Create the Location and Contact Page.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Design a page displaying the church’s location (with free parking information) and contact details. Integrate Google Maps for location visualization.
* *How to Measure*: The location is accurately displayed on the map, and contact details are easily accessible.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# Google Maps is integrated and displays the correct location.
*# Contact details include a form and direct contact links (email, phone).
*# The design is responsive and clean.

Summary: Develop a Bible Listening Page with an embedded player.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Create a page where users can listen to audio versions of the Bible. The page should feature a simple, intuitive audio player.
* *How to Measure*: Users can play, pause, and navigate through the audio files seamlessly.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# The audio player is embedded and functional.
*# Users can navigate between different Bible chapters.
*# The page is visually appealing and user-friendly.

Summary: Implement the Donations Page with a payment gateway.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Create a Donations Page where users can donate using a free payment gateway. Include options for one-time and recurring donations.
* *How to Measure*: Donations can be made successfully, and confirmation messages are displayed.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# Payment integration works without errors.
*# Users can select donation frequency.
*# The design aligns with the project’s theme.

Summary: Develop the Events Page with an interactive calendar.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Create an Events Page displaying a calendar of upcoming church activities and events. Users should be able to click on an event to view details.
* *How to Measure*: The calendar is functional, and event details can be accessed with a click.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# The calendar displays all scheduled events.
*# Event details open in a modal or dedicated section.
*# The page is fully responsive.

Summary: Develop a responsive Navbar component.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Create a reusable Navbar component with links to all major pages (Home, About, Events, Donations, and Contact). Implement responsiveness for mobile and desktop views.
* *How to Measure*: The Navbar is fully functional and adjusts seamlessly to different screen sizes.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# The Navbar contains all required links.
*# The design matches the project’s style guide.
*# The component is responsive and tested on multiple devices.

Summary: Set up the React project environment for the church web app.
Creator: Melisa Battal
Description:
* *Description*: Install all necessary dependencies, configure the project structure, and ensure the development environment is ready for the team.
* *How to Measure*: The project runs successfully with {{npm start}}, and all dependencies are correctly installed.
* *Acceptance Criteria*:
*# The project structure follows best practices.
*# All dependencies are listed and functional.
*# The application starts successfully with no errors.
